paragraphs.text: %md # Loading External Jars ### There is nothing elegent about loading external jars at the command line. ``` $ bin/start-scala-shell.sh remote localhost 6123 --addclasspath lib/flinkML-2.10-1.1.2.jar ``` ### **Paradox:** This is tedious to do at the commmand line and novice users are most likely to use command line!

result.msg:
Loading External Jars

There is nothing elegent about loading external jars at the command line.

$ bin/start-scala-shell.sh remote localhost 6123  --addclasspath lib/flinkML-2.10-1.1.2.jar

Paradox: This is tedious to do at the commmand line and novice users are most likely to use command line!

paragraphs.title: Load the Sample Linear Data from the examples package: FAILS
paragraphs.text:
%flinkNoJars

import org.apache.flink.examples.java.ml.util.LinearRegressionData

case class Data(var x: Double, var y: Double)
 
val data = LinearRegressionData.DATA map {
  case Array(x, y) => Data(x.asInstanceOf[Double], y.asInstanceOf[Double])
}

val dataDS = benv.fromCollection(data)

result.msg:
<console>:17: error: object examples is not a member of package org.apache.flink
            import org.apache.flink.examples.java.ml.util.LinearRegressionData
                                    ^

paragraphs.text:
%md
### **Solution:** Add `org.apache.flink:flink-examples-batch_2.10:1.1.2` Examples to [Interpreters](http://flinkforward-16-zeppelin.mybluemix.net/#/interpreter)

### Do it once, it exists in that interpreter forever.

result.msg:
Solution: Add org.apache.flink:flink-examples-batch_2.10:1.1.2 Examples to Interpreters

Do it once, it exists in that interpreter forever.

paragraphs.title: Load the Sample Linear Data from the examples package: SUCCESS
paragraphs.text:
%flinkNoJars

import org.apache.flink.examples.java.ml.util.LinearRegressionData

case class Data(var x: Double, var y: Double)
 
val data = LinearRegressionData.DATA map {
  case Array(x, y) => Data(x.asInstanceOf[Double], y.asInstanceOf[Double])
}

val dataDS = benv.fromCollection(data)

result.msg:
import org.apache.flink.examples.java.ml.util.LinearRegressionData
defined class Data
data: Array[Data] = Array(Data(0.5,1.0), Data(1.0,2.0), Data(2.0,4.0), Data(3.0,6.0), Data(4.0,8.0), Data(5.0,10.0), Data(6.0,12.0), Data(7.0,14.0), Data(8.0,16.0), Data(9.0,18.0), Data(10.0,20.0), Data(-0.08,-0.16), Data(0.13,0.26), Data(-1.17,-2.35), Data(1.72,3.45), Data(1.7,3.41), Data(1.2,2.41), Data(-0.59,-1.18), Data(0.28,0.57), Data(1.65,3.3), Data(-0.55,-1.08))
dataDS: org.apache.flink.api.scala.DataSet[Data] = org.apache.flink.api.scala.DataSet@c9eb23f3

paragraphs.title: Wrap Up
paragraphs.text: %md # Conclusion: Act 1 ### Of course, nothing we have done here (or will do in the entire presentation) is *new* or *couldn't be done* with existing tools. What Zeppelin+Flink does is make *__easier__* to do the things that you have to do to get up and running in Flink, and hopefully lowers the barriers to entry of those who are curious. ### Zeppelin + Flink makes it easy for new users to - ### Start experimenting with Flink with minimal understanding of Linux / Distributed Computing / Streaming Processors / etc. - ### Copy+Paste+Run Introductory Examples - ### Add Dependency+Copy+Paste+Run for slightly more complex examples

result.msg:
Conclusion: Act 1

Of course, nothing we have done here (or will do in the entire presentation) is new or couldn't be done with existing tools. What Zeppelin+Flink does is make easier to do the things that you have to do to get up and running in Flink, and hopefully lowers the barriers to entry of those who are curious.

Zeppelin + Flink makes it easy for new users to

  • Start experimenting with Flink with minimal understanding of Linux / Distributed Computing / Streaming Processors / etc.

  • Copy+Paste+Run Introductory Examples

  • Add Dependency+Copy+Paste+Run for slightly more complex examples
